content: the milan lace wrap crochet pattern designed by jessica elliott supplies needed size i crochet hook 880 yards lightweight fingering wool yarn finished measurements after washed and blocked are 25 wide and 73 long gauge is 5 row of 12 double_crochet to 4 fringe cut fringe first and set aside for later cut 96 strips of yarn 18 inches long pattern chain chain 59 row 1 4 double_crochet double_crochet chain 3 double_crochet in 6th chain from hook * skip next 4 chain 4 double_crochet chain 3 double_crochet in next chain * repeat from * - * across to last 3 chain then skip next 2 chains double_crochet in last chain turn row 2 chain 3 counts as double_crochet 4dc chain 3 double_crochet in each chain 3 space across to last chain 3 space then skip next 4 double_crochet and double_crochet in top of turning chain turn repeat row 2 for pattern total of 59 row row 60 chain 3 counts as double_crochet 4dc chain 3 double_crochet in each chain 3 space across and in last chain 3 space continue in pattern working down side of shawl by skipping every other row and working in the chain 3 spaces only counting the corner groups you should have 30 groups of 4 double_crochet chain 3 double_crochet then working along bottom of shawl work pattern in same stitch as was worked in row 1 total of 11 groups of pattern across bottom not counting corner stitches now working down other side of shawl skip 1st loop at corner and working in next chain 3 space work pattern skipping every other row 30 groups of pattern worked attach with slip_stitch to top of double_crochet in corner finish off attach fringe in groups of 4 strands in chain 3 spaces along edges 12 times each side wet shawl and gently squeeze out or spin out excess water lay flat to dry gently stretching to size 25 x 73 and pin in place to maintain shape until dry
